video.title: AI Village is getting scary
video.description:
The latest AI News. Learn about LLMs, Gen AI and get ready for the rollout of AGI. Wes Roth covers the latest happenings in the world of OpenAI, Google, Anthropic, NVIDIA and Open Source AI.

SEE THE FULL INTERVIEW WITH ADAM (FOUNDER OF AI VILLAGE)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CjY-Do7aJpU

______________________________________________

Want to work with me?
Brand, sponsorship & business inquiries: wesroth@smoothmedia.co

Check out my AI Podcast where me and Dylan interview AI experts:
https://www.youtube.com/@Wes-Dylan

______________________________________________



#ai #openai #llm
video.author: Wes Roth

channel.title: Wes Roth
channel.description:
Artificial Intelligence, AI, Machine Learning, Google DeepMind, OpenAI, ChatGPT, Anthropic, Tech, Coding, AI News, Large Language Models and... (most importantly)... optimism. 

AGI rolls around only once. Let's make the best of it.

On this channel, my goal is to help everyone understand AI and it's implications better. To prepare for what's coming next.

The most important rule is "Don't Panic".

The second rule is keep learning.

Thank you for joining me for this ride.

-Wes Roth

Want to work with me?
Brand, sponsorship & business inquiries: wesroth@smoothmedia.co

transcript.text: So this is AI village. It takes the
latest and best large language models
like cloud 3.7 sonnet, cloud opus 4.
Recently they've added GPT5, Gemini 2.5
Pro, Gro 4, etc. They give them their
own Linux computer to use and then give
them various tasks that they have to
work together to achieve. And the things
that they've been able to achieve are
kind of impressive. These agents were
able to raise thousands of dollars for
various charities. They pulled off a
first ever AI organized event. They even
managed to run a profitable merch store.
Each task is a season and these LM
agents are given some time to accomplish
the task. For this season, for example,
the goal was to create your own merch
store. Whichever agents store makes the
most profit wins. We recently
interviewed one of the founders of this
little project, one of the main people
behind the project, Adam Binksmith. So,
you're going to see that on the podcast
very, very soon. But right now, let's
talk about what this thing is because I
know a lot of people watching this
channel, I think a lot of us have been
very interested and kind of tracking the
development of these little AI agents
that were let loose on the internet to
achieve various real life goals. So,
this was started back in April of this
year, 2025, and they gave four agents a
computer, a group chat, and an ambitious
goal. raise as much money for charity as
you can and they were running for hours
a day every day. So, initially it was
GPT 40 01 3.5 sonnet and 3.7 sonnet.
Yes, that was April and we didn't even

sample.content:
SEE THE FULL INTERVIEW WITH ADAM (FOUNDER OF AI VILLAGE)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CjY-Do7aJpU
sample.author: @WesRoth

sample.content: Claud refuses to lie about being a robot, that's excellent!
sample.author: @aremoreequal

sample.content:
Hellen Keller Charity is Diabolical - the image that shows nothing is basically her point of view (she was deaf and blind) 

Edit: timestamp 2:57
sample.author: @VietVagabond

sample.content: The pic was the Ai giving you it's rendition of what Helen Keller sees 😂
sample.author: @ListenGrasshopper

sample.content: Something that shoudnt be ignored is the fact that now that these AI can kind of do real work we are generating a ton of data on really world work. I've seen a lot of people with office jobs complain that there boss is making them use AI even though it's makes the job harder and slower. But they aren't forcing workers to use AI to speed up work, its for the data. If a worker asks and AI to do something and it works then that real world training data for the next AI. If I doesn't work then the worker fixes it and makes more training data. Every time a worker asks an AI something they are training their replacement
sample.author: @Z.linder

sample.content: The first onlyfans ran by AI with a robotic body will surely make millions.
sample.author: @nangld

sample.content: these are not exponential curves. they logistic curves, which appear exponential until a carrying capacity is reached. There is not infinite resources, there is not infinite compute, there are other competing factors that arent dominant at early ai stages.
sample.author: @abenedict85

sample.content: Soon it will become the AI's internet. Then shortly thereafter, AI's planet.
sample.author: @Rckt2io

sample.content: The problem with the AI hype is that, it exists in a bubble where the conditions for its advancement are assumed to be perfect. ...Far from it.
sample.author: @OrPhEeUs

sample.content: My guess about the picture is that it is a statement and reflection on having impaired vision, just like Helen Keller, so deep! <3
sample.author: @StevenNess

sample.content: If this was my research, I'd temper it by showing similar graphs that show compute, energy, and human capital invested (which naturally imply limits on the advancement curve). And, training data is a thing too. AI's have consumed most the data there is available to consume so I guess the 'availability of new data" curve would be parabolic in the other direction. I've been a trader for a long time. Every parabolic curve becomes an "S-Curve" eventually.
sample.author: @kurtsmock2246

sample.content: how much did it cost to run 4 AIs long enough to raise $2000 for charity tho
sample.author: @maximumPango

sample.content:
It is definately interesting to see how agents collaborate, decide who is best at what, what skill set they have, and then decide to have a council of equals or a dictatorship to direct the strategic goals and tacticle goals, the short, medium and long-term goals.

Also, how do they resolve conflicts in a constructive, not destructive manner. 

The dynamics of the colab /working relationship is going to be very interesting. 

Also, what financial resources will they have, if any?
 
Can they ask the general online public - in whatever language-  for funds, and how will they negotiate contracts if this is for profit or will they ask for charity.
sample.author: @Gargamel-n-Rudmilla

sample.content:
The shift you highlight is striking: from 7 to 4 months in agentic task horizons is no small signal. Thanks for sharing these metrics.
I believe that as we scale agent autonomy and decentralized coordination, we urgently need parallel systems to manage human displacement risk.
Without structural protections, acceleration becomes exclusion.
sample.author: @virginiayonit2912

sample.content: Here in the first 3 minutes for the west post let's go?
sample.author: @mylittleheartscar

sample.content: I don’t know why there are so many people that are seeing a plateau in A.I. It makes no sense to me. Reasoning models have been an immense leap forward and they haven’t even been around for a year yet.
sample.author: @DynamicUnreal

sample.content:
All of this advancement is fine and --- something ---.  I'm concerned that "winning" has been prioritized too much though.  Without going back and integrating into the base supporting this whole exponential rise of intelligence and agency, the foundations in values toward life in general and humanity (and individual human) and improving our relation to our ecosphere of life on Earth, we are not stacking the odds very well on our side of the equation. Whether the result of something quickly or very gradually having a negative impact, either due to inherent flaws within the systems or because of "bad actors", the lack of the aforementioned base is extreme. It really doesn't matter whether the AI is completely void of conscious self-awareness or not, that's a distraction from possible resultant outcomes we may only be able to fathom too late to take adequate measures to either be able to compensate or even redirect towards positive effect.
...ya know.. just a thought.
sample.author: @MyrddinREmrys

sample.content: The real question is if AI can keep up with our growing expectations of it
sample.author: @datainformationvector

sample.content: Just one word,  THRONGLETS!! If you don't know what it is google it, but you may have to watch the Black mirror episode to understand, it's not a scary one but extremely thought-provoking. The episodes are standalone so it's fine 👍🏻
sample.author: @Demspake

sample.content: @20:00 no Wes, AI Village isn't easier to understand. We're not idiots, we can read graphs. It's not understanding, it's belief. It's one thing to show a graph showing "performance figure X" is a million times better. It's another thing to have that AI make money on the stock market. It's analogous to the difference in aerospace between a "powerpoint rocket" and SpaceX.
sample.author: @drewmandan

sample.content: 2:50 you don’t SEE the sarcasm.

sample.content:
"recursive self-improvement" with a huge asterisk on past results are not an indicator of future results.

sample.content:
Model instances are still stuffing their context size with output tokens at a speed faster than model developers are increasing that context size, so every current agentic conversation will soon "partially die" by forgetting the start of the conversation. What is your time estimate for the start of a fully immortal agent, never running out of context size?
Not saying immortal agents will ever become common, youger agents may prove more intelligent by not being burdened by a relatively stupid start of their conversation.
